title: Blended Instructional Design Course for Integrated Scientific and Mathematical Thinking

context.prior_knowledge: Basic science and mathematics knowledge, ability to use online learning tools
context.additional_context: Online-blended instructional environment grounded in reflective teaching methodologies

learning_goals: Learners can explain the interconnections between scientific and mathematical concepts through real-world case analysis

Over a 2–4-week mid-term course, learners can design collaborative problem-solving activities (problem definition, collaboration strategy development, solution proposal) on online platforms like Google Classroom or Padlet and submit an implementation report meeting ≥4 out of 5 rubric items (4+ points/5-point scale) in peer evaluations.

Learners can write reflective journals (twice weekly, A4 one-page each) for two weeks, then propose ≥three specific instructional strategy improvements incorporating peer feedback (≥two peers) and rubric evaluations (5-point scale, ≥4 points).

Applying integrated instructional design principles (based on the ADDIE model), learners can develop two weeks' worth of teaching-learning materials (10-slide lecture PPT, two activity sheets, five assessment questions) and achieve an "Excellent" grade in ≥four of five peer evaluation rubric items.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
